required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preliminary Study of Piclozotan in Patients With Motor Complications Associated With Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Preliminary Study of the Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of Intravenous SUN N4057 in Patients With Motor Complications Associated With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to obtain preliminary information on the effect of piclozotan on motor complications associated with Parkinson's Disease.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Percentage of "On" Time Without Dyskinesia Averaged Over Days 1 and 2 in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline up to Day 2 in the Percentage of "on" Time Without Dyskinesia, as Assessed Over Hours 1 to 8 for Each Time Point in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of "on" Time With Dyskinesia at Baseline up to Day 2, and the Change From Baseline in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response). Negative values indicate a decrease in "on" time from baseline to measured time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of "on" Time With Dyskinesia for the Average of Days 1 and 2, and the Change From Baseline in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response). Negative values indicate a decrease in "on" time from baseline to measured time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of "on" Time With or Without Dyskinesia at Baseline up to Day 2, and the Change From Baseline in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response). Negative values indicate a decrease in "on" time from baseline to measured time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of "on" Time With or Without Dyskinesia for the Average of Days 1 and 2, and the Change From Baseline in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response). Negative values indicate a decrease in "on" time from baseline to measured time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of "Off" Time at Baseline up to Day 2, and the Change From Baseline in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response). Negative values indicate a decrease in "off" time from baseline to measured time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of "Off" Time for the Average of Days 1 and 2, and the Change From Baseline in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response). Negative values indicate a decrease in "off" time from baseline to measured time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline up to Day 2 in the Average Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: The Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) is an assessment of dyskinesia in patients with movement disorders. The AIMS was originally developed to assess neuroleptic-induced extrapyramidal symptoms but has also been applied to the assessment of dyskinesia in patients with Parkinson's disease. AIMS questions 1 to 7 rate the degree of dyskinesia on a 0 to 4 scale in the extremities, trunk, and face, where 0 is no dyskinesia (better outcome) and 4 is severe dyskinesia (worse outcome). The total score range is 0 (better outcome) to 28 (worse outcome). Higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average of Days 1 and 2 in the Average Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: The Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) is an assessment of dyskinesia in patients with movement disorders. The AIMS was originally developed to assess neuroleptic-induced extrapyramidal symptoms but has also been applied to the assessment of dyskinesia in patients with Parkinson's disease. AIMS questions 1 to 7 rate the degree of dyskinesia on a 0 to 4 scale in the extremities, trunk, and face, where 0 is no dyskinesia (better outcome) and 4 is severe dyskinesia (worse outcome). The total score range is 0 (better outcome) to 28 (worse outcome). Higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Concentrations Over Time Following Treatment With SUN N4057
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 pre-dose (Hour 0), 1 hour, 6 hours, 12 hours; Day 2 pre-dose (Hour 24), 1 hour (Hour 25), 6 hours (Hour 30), 12 hours (Hour 36), and Day 3 Hour 0 (Hour 48) post-dose.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean concentration of study drug, SUN N4057, in participant blood plasma samples drawn during infusions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Maximum Concentration (Cmax) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1 pre-dose) up to Hour 24, and Hour 48 post-dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is the observed maximum concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample after drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Minimum Concentration (Cmin) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 pre-dose (Hour 0) up to Hour 24, and Hour 48 post-dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmin is the observed minimum concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample after drug administration. Average of C24 and C48 [ie, 24 hours after the initiation of infusion on Days 1 and 2. Cmin = average of (C24 and C48)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Mean Concentration (Caverage) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at 1 hour, 6 hours, and12 hours; Day 2 at 25 hours, 30 hours, and 36 hours post-dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Caverage is the mean concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample obtained from the observed concentrations during the 2-day drug infusions (average of C1, C6, C12, C25, C30, and C36 [ie, Hours 1, 6, 12, 25, 30, and 36 after the initiation of infusion on Day 1]). Caverage = average of (C1, C6, C12, C25, C30, and C36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean SUN N4057 Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Area Under the Drug Concentration vs Time Curve (AUCt) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1 pre-dose) up to Hour 0, Hour 1, Hour 6, Hour 12, Hour 24, Hour 25, Hour 30, Hour 36, and Hour 48 post-dose.
secondary_outcome.description: AUCt is defined as the area under the drug concentration vs time curve from zero up to the last sampling point with a quantifiable drug concentration which is above the lower limit of quantification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-Related Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events Reported Following Treatment With SUN N4057 or Placebo
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 16 post-dose, up to approximately a total 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an Adverse Event (AE) that was new in onset or aggravated in severity or frequency following administration of the investigational agent. This included any change from the screening physical examination findings or results of diagnostic procedures (eg, laboratory test, ECG) that were clinically significant, eg, required diagnostic or therapeutic intervention beyond confirmation alone.

arm_group.description: Participants will be randomized to receive two 12-hour intravenous (IV) infusions of piclozotan administered at a plasma level of 30 ng/mL over 2 inpatient days.
Participants will be randomized to receive two 12-hour intravenous (IV) infusions of 0.9 % sodium chloride (normal saline) administered at a plasma level of 30 ng/mL over 2 inpatient days.

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- Idiopathic Parkinson's disease for at least 5 years
- Presence of motor fluctuations and dyskinesia
- Stable regimen of levodopa/carbidopa for 30 days
- At least 25% response/improvement in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) part III scores after dosing with regular Parkinson's disease (PD) medications
- Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score of 25 or higher
Main Exclusion Criteria:
- Atypical or secondary parkinsonism.
- Prior use of neuroleptic agents.
- History of intracranial procedures for PD.
- Active psychosis.
- History of drug or alcohol abuse in past 12 months.
- Cardiac conduction system abnormality.
- Predisposing medical condition that causes nausea or vomiting or routine use of an anti-emetic.

facility.name: The Parkinson's and Movement Disorder Institute
University of South Florida, Parkinson's Disease and Movement Disorders Center
Hospital Clinic of Neurology and Psychiatry Oradea

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 27 participants who met all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria were enrolled in the study at 4 clinic sites in the United States of America (USA), 1 in Guatemala, and 1 in Romania.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of 0.9% sodium chloride (normal saline) placebo over 2 inpatient days.

group.title: SUN N4057
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics were assessed using the Safety population.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Percentage of "On" Time Without Dyskinesia Averaged Over Days 1 and 2 in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
outcome.description: Improvement in motor complications associated with Parkinson's disease are measured as "on" (good medication response); OR "on with dyskinesia" (good medication response, but with superimposed involuntary movements that interfere with activities), OR "off" (poor medication response).
outcome.population: The percentage of "on" time without dyskinesia was assessed using the modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline up to Day 2 in the Average Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score in Participants Treated With SUN N4057 and Those Treated With a Placebo
outcome.description: The Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) is an assessment of dyskinesia in patients with movement disorders. The AIMS was originally developed to assess neuroleptic-induced extrapyramidal symptoms but has also been applied to the assessment of dyskinesia in patients with Parkinson's disease. AIMS questions 1 to 7 rate the degree of dyskinesia on a 0 to 4 scale in the extremities, trunk, and face, where 0 is no dyskinesia (better outcome) and 4 is severe dyskinesia (worse outcome). The total score range is 0 (better outcome) to 28 (worse outcome). Higher scores indicate a worse outcome.
outcome.population: The average abnormal involuntary movement scale was assessed using the modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population.

outcome.title: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Maximum Concentration (Cmax) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
outcome.description: Cmax is the observed maximum concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample after drug administration.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1 pre-dose) up to Hour 24, and Hour 48 post-dose.
outcome.population: Cmax was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

group.title: SUN N4057
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

measure.title: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Maximum Concentration (Cmax) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
measure.description: Cmax is the observed maximum concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample after drug administration.
measure.population: Cmax was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

outcome.title: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Minimum Concentration (Cmin) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
outcome.description: Cmin is the observed minimum concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample after drug administration. Average of C24 and C48 [ie, 24 hours after the initiation of infusion on Days 1 and 2. Cmin = average of (C24 and C48)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 pre-dose (Hour 0) up to Hour 24, and Hour 48 post-dose.
outcome.population: Cmin was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

group.title: SUN N4057
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

measure.title: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Minimum Concentration (Cmin) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
measure.description: Cmin is the observed minimum concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample after drug administration. Average of C24 and C48 [ie, 24 hours after the initiation of infusion on Days 1 and 2. Cmin = average of (C24 and C48)
measure.population: Cmin was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

outcome.title: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Mean Concentration (Caverage) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
outcome.description: Caverage is the mean concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample obtained from the observed concentrations during the 2-day drug infusions (average of C1, C6, C12, C25, C30, and C36 [ie, Hours 1, 6, 12, 25, 30, and 36 after the initiation of infusion on Day 1]). Caverage = average of (C1, C6, C12, C25, C30, and C36)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at 1 hour, 6 hours, and12 hours; Day 2 at 25 hours, 30 hours, and 36 hours post-dose.
outcome.population: Caverage was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

group.title: SUN N4057
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

measure.title: Mean SUN N4057 Plasma Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Observed Mean Concentration (Caverage) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
measure.description: Caverage is the mean concentration of SUN N4057 in the participant blood plasma sample obtained from the observed concentrations during the 2-day drug infusions (average of C1, C6, C12, C25, C30, and C36 [ie, Hours 1, 6, 12, 25, 30, and 36 after the initiation of infusion on Day 1]). Caverage = average of (C1, C6, C12, C25, C30, and C36)
measure.population: Caverage was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

outcome.title: Mean SUN N4057 Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Area Under the Drug Concentration vs Time Curve (AUCt) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
outcome.description: AUCt is defined as the area under the drug concentration vs time curve from zero up to the last sampling point with a quantifiable drug concentration which is above the lower limit of quantification.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1 pre-dose) up to Hour 0, Hour 1, Hour 6, Hour 12, Hour 24, Hour 25, Hour 30, Hour 36, and Hour 48 post-dose.
outcome.population: AUCt was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

group.title: SUN N4057
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

measure.title: Mean SUN N4057 Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Area Under the Drug Concentration vs Time Curve (AUCt) Following Treatment With SUN N4057
measure.description: AUCt is defined as the area under the drug concentration vs time curve from zero up to the last sampling point with a quantifiable drug concentration which is above the lower limit of quantification.
measure.population: AUCt was assessed using the pharmacokinetic (PK) population.

outcome.title: Treatment-Related Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events Reported Following Treatment With SUN N4057 or Placebo
outcome.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an Adverse Event (AE) that was new in onset or aggravated in severity or frequency following administration of the investigational agent. This included any change from the screening physical examination findings or results of diagnostic procedures (eg, laboratory test, ECG) that were clinically significant, eg, required diagnostic or therapeutic intervention beyond confirmation alone.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 16 post-dose, up to approximately a total 12 months.
outcome.population: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were assessed using the Safety population.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of 0.9% sodium chloride (normal saline) placebo over 2 inpatient days.

group.title: SUN N4057
group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

measure.title: Treatment-Related Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events Reported Following Treatment With SUN N4057 or Placebo
measure.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an Adverse Event (AE) that was new in onset or aggravated in severity or frequency following administration of the investigational agent. This included any change from the screening physical examination findings or results of diagnostic procedures (eg, laboratory test, ECG) that were clinically significant, eg, required diagnostic or therapeutic intervention beyond confirmation alone.
measure.population: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were assessed using the Safety population.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were assessed from the date the informed consent was given to Day 16 post-dose, up to approximately a total of 12 months.
reported_events.desc: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an Adverse Event (AE) that was new in onset or aggravated in severity or frequency following administration of the investigational agent. This included any change from the screening physical examination findings or results of diagnostic procedures (eg, laboratory test, ECG) that were clinically significant, eg, required diagnostic or therapeutic intervention beyond confirmation alone.

group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of 0.9% sodium chloride (normal saline) placebo over 2 inpatient days.

group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease who were administered two 12-hour IV infusions of SUN N4057 (piclozotan) over 2 inpatient days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
